durability_reason: The project includes a restrictive covenant on the property titles, constituting a long‑term legal agreement, and it outlines ongoing monitoring and a partnership agreement to re‑engage local communities, indicating continued revenue generation and institutional responsibility beyond the initial project period.
level_support_sentences: The project activity involves sustainable development by involving and employing members of local communities in eco‑tourism activities in the project area, helping develop new livelihoods compatible with conservation and furthering community development goals.
Activities implemented as part of the project to reduce deforestation include community outreach and employment of local community members as project forest guards or other project staff positions.
The project generates net positive impacts on the social and economic well‑being of local communities by providing employment in patrol and protection activities.
The project generates net positive impacts on the social and economic well‑being of local communities by providing employment in patrol and protection activities.

The goal of the project is to develop the project as a carbon sink by conserving and protecting the property, which will maintain its biodiversity values and enhance the local economic environment with sustainable livelihoods through private‑sector eco‑tourism.
evidence_quality_support_sentences: The project activity involves sustainable development by involving and employing members of local communities in eco‑tourism activities in the project area, helping develop new livelihoods compatible with conservation and furthering community development goals.
Nevertheless, surrounding communities earn their livelihoods through a mixture of ecotourism, subsistence farming, and small‑scale agricultural market participation.
The project generates net positive impacts on the social and economic well‑being of local communities by providing employment in patrol and protection activities.
durability_support_sentences: The major project activities are: partner with BLE to conduct ecotourism activities at the site to generate income for expenses of maintaining and managing the property; control access to the project site through regular patrols; continue to interact with the local communities; place a restrictive covenant on the titles; and monitor results.
BCEP is currently finalizing an agreement with a new project partner to reinitiate ecotourism activities in the project area and re‑engage local communities in the next monitoring period.
sdg_claim_support_sentences: The project activity involves sustainable development by involving and employing members of local communities in eco‑tourism activities in the project area, helping develop new livelihoods compatible with conservation and furthering community development goals.

The major project activities are: partner with BLE to conduct ecotourism activities at the site to generate income for expenses of maintaining and managing the property; control access to the project site through regular patrols; continue to interact with the local communities; place a restrictive covenant on the titles; and monitor results.
Activities implemented as part of the project to reduce deforestation include community outreach and employment of local community members as project forest guards or other project staff positions.
The project generates net positive impacts on the social and economic well‑being of local communities by providing employment in patrol and protection activities.

The goal of the project is to develop the project as a carbon sink by conserving and protecting the property, which will maintain its biodiversity values and enhance the local economic environment with sustainable livelihoods through private‑sector eco‑tourism.
A successful and financially stable BCEP will provide livelihoods both through management of the property and through the ecotourism operations conducted by BLE.

Members of the local communities are the primary employees of BCEP, participating in permanent sample plot measuring, setting up remote large‑mammal camera traps, setting up acoustic recording devices, conducting forest patrols, educating other local community members about forest protection, and engaging in other knowledge‑transfer activities.

Audit team interviews with local stakeholders confirm that there are few employers or stable economic activities nearby, supporting the assertion that the project's employment has a net positive effect on the community.
